register.description: This register enables the domain power state transition. It controls the HW supervised domain power state transition between ON-ACTIVE and ON-INACTIVE states. It also hold one status bit per clock input of the domain.

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the SATA_REF_GFCLK clock in the domain. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is running or gating/ungating transition is on-going

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the L3INIT_32K_FCLK clock in the domain. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is running or gating/ungating transition is on-going

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the L3INIT_960M_GFCLK clock in the domain. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is running or gating/ungating transition is on-going

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the L3INIT_480M_GFCLK clock in the domain. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is running or gating/ungating transition is on-going

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the USB_OTG_SS_REF_CLK clock in the domain. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is running or gating/ungating transition is on-going

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is running or gating/ungating transition is on-going

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is running or gating/ungating transition is on-going

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the MLB_SHB_L3_GICLK clock in the domain. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is running or gating/ungating transition is on-going

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the MMC2 clock in the domain. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is running or gating/ungating transition is on-going

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the MMC1_GFCLK clock in the domain. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is running or gating/ungating transition is on-going

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the HSI_GFCLK clock in the domain. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is running or gating/ungating transition is on-going

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the USB_DPLL_HS_CLK clock in the domain. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is running or gating/ungating transition is on-going

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the USB_DPLL_CLK clock in the domain. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is running or gating/ungating transition is on-going

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the INIT_48M_GFCLK clock in the domain. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is running or gating/ungating transition is on-going

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the L3INIT_USB_LFPS_TX_GFCLK clock in the domain. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is running or gating/ungating transition is on-going

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the L3INIT_L4_GICLK clock in the domain. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is running or gating/ungating transition is on-going

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the L3INIT_L3_GICLK clock in the domain. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is running or gating/ungating transition is on-going

bitfield.description: Controls the clock state transition of the L3INIT clock domain.

bitenum.description: NO_SLEEP: Sleep transition cannot be initiated. Wakeup transition may however occur.
SW_SLEEP: Start a software forced sleep transition on the domain.
SW_WKUP: Start a software forced wake-up transition on the domain.
HW_AUTO: Automatic transition is enabled. Sleep and wakeup transition are based upon hardware conditions.

register.description: This register controls the static domain depedencies from L3INIT domain towards 'target' domains. It is relevant only for domain having system initiator(s).

bitfield.description: Static dependency towards L4PER3 clock domain
Static dependency towards WKUPAON clock domain
Static dependency towards L4SEC clock domain
Static dependency towards L4PER1 clock domain
Static dependency towards L4CFG clock domain
Static dependency towards L3MAIN1 clock domain
Static dependency towards EMIF clock domain
Static dependency towards IVA clock domain

register.description: This register controls the dynamic domain depedencies from L3INIT domain towards 'target' domains. It is relevant only for domain having OCP master port(s).

bitfield.description: Dynamic dependency towards L3MAIN1 clock domain

register.description: This register manages the MMC1 clocks.

bitfield.description: MMC1 clock divide ratio.
Selects the source of the functional clock.

bitenum.description: 128MHz clock derived from DPLL_PER is selected
192MHz clock derived from DPLL_PER is selected

bitfield.description: Module standby status. [warm reset insensitive]
Module idle status. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Module is fully functional, including OCP
Module is performing transition: wakeup, or sleep, or sleep abortion
Module is in Idle mode (only OCP part). It is functional if using separate functional clock
Module is disabled and cannot be accessed

bitfield.description: MMC optional clock control: 32K CLK
Control the way mandatory clocks are managed.

bitenum.description: Module is disabled by SW. Any OCP access to module results in an error, except if resulting from a module wakeup (asynchronous wakeup).

Module is explicitly enabled. Interface clock (if not used for functions) may be gated according to the clock domain state. Functional clocks are guaranteed to stay present. As long as in this configuration, power domain sleep transition cannot happen.

register.description: This register manages the MMC2 clocks.

bitfield.description: MMC2 clock divide ratio
Selects the source of the functional clock.

bitenum.description: 128MHz clock derived from DPLL_PER is selected
192MHz clock derived from DPLL_PER is selected

bitfield.description: Module standby status. [warm reset insensitive]
Module idle status. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Module is fully functional, including OCP
Module is performing transition: wakeup, or sleep, or sleep abortion
Module is in Idle mode (only OCP part). It is functional if using separate functional clock
Module is disabled and cannot be accessed

bitfield.description: MMC optional clock control: 32K CLK
Control the way mandatory clocks are managed.

bitenum.description: Module is disabled by SW. Any OCP access to module results in an error, except if resulting from a module wakeup (asynchronous wakeup).

Module is explicitly enabled. Interface clock (if not used for functions) may be gated according to the clock domain state. Functional clocks are guaranteed to stay present. As long as in this configuration, power domain sleep transition cannot happen.

register.description: This register manages the USB_OTG_SS2 clocks.

bitfield.description: Module standby status. [warm reset insensitive]
Module idle status. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Module is fully functional, including OCP
Module is performing transition: wakeup, or sleep, or sleep abortion
Module is in Idle mode (only OCP part). It is functional if using separate functional clock
Module is disabled and cannot be accessed

bitfield.description: USB_OTG_SS optional clock control: REFCLK960M (960MHz clock)
Control the way mandatory clocks are managed.

bitenum.description: Module is disabled by SW. Any OCP access to module results in an error, except if resulting from a module wakeup (asynchronous wakeup).

Module is managed automatically by HW according to clock domain transition. A clock domain sleep transition put module into idle. A wakeup domain transition put it back into function. If CLKTRCTRL=3, any OCP access to module is always granted. Module clocks may be gated according to the clock domain state.

bitfield.description: Module standby status. [warm reset insensitive]
Module idle status. [warm reset insensitive]

Module is in Idle mode (only OCP part). It is functional if using separate functional clock
Module is disabled and cannot be accessed

bitfield.description: Control the way mandatory clocks are managed.

bitenum.description: Module is disabled by SW. Any OCP access to module results in an error, except if resulting from a module wakeup (asynchronous wakeup).

Module is managed automatically by HW according to clock domain transition. A clock domain sleep transition put module into idle. A wakeup domain transition put it back into function. If CLKTRCTRL=3, any OCP access to module is always granted. Module clocks may be gated according to the clock domain state.

bitenum.description: Module is disabled by SW. Any OCP access to module results in an error, except if resulting from a module wakeup (asynchronous wakeup).

Module is managed automatically by HW according to clock domain transition. A clock domain sleep transition put module into idle. A wakeup domain transition put it back into function. bitenum.description: Module is managed automatically by HW according to clock domain transition. A clock domain sleep transition put module into idle. bitenum.description: Module is fully functional, including OCP

Module is in Idle mode (only OCP part). It is functional if using separate functional clock

register.description: This register controls the static domain depedencies from PCIE domain towards 'target' domains. It is relevant only for domain having system initiator(s).

register.description: This register manages the PCESS1 clocks.

bitfield.description: Module standby status. [warm reset insensitive]
Module idle status. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Module is fully functional, including OCP
Module is performing transition: wakeup, or sleep, or sleep abortion
Module is in Idle mode (only OCP part). It is functional if using separate functional clock
Module is disabled and cannot be accessed

bitfield.description: PCIE PHY optional clock control
PCIE PHY optional clock control
PCIE PHY optional clock control

Control the way mandatory clocks are managed.Note: In order to disable the APLL_PCIE, the user needs to disable PCIe_SSx (where x = 1 or 2) using the CM_PCIE_ PCIESSx_CLKCTRL[1:0] MODULEMODE registers. When PCIe_SS is disabled, the PRCM module automatically disables the APLL_PCIE. Please note that setting [1:0] MODE_SELECT bitfield to 0x0 does not disable the APLL_PCIE. .

bitenum.description: Module is disabled by SW. Any OCP access to module results in an error, except if resulting from a module wakeup (asynchronous wakeup).

Module is explicitly enabled. Interface clock (if not used for functions) may be gated according to the clock domain state. Functional clocks are guaranteed to stay present. As long as in this configuration, power domain sleep transition cannot happen.

bitfield.description: Module standby status. [warm reset insensitive]
Module idle status. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Module is fully functional, including OCP
Module is performing transition: wakeup, or sleep, or sleep abortion
Module is in Idle mode (only OCP part). It is functional if using separate functional clock
Module is disabled and cannot be accessed

bitfield.description: PCIE PHY optional clock control
PCIE PHY optional clock control
PCIE PHY optional clock control

Control the way mandatory clocks are managed.Note: In order to disable the APLL_PCIE, the user needs to disable PCIe_SSx (where x = 1 or 2) using the CM_PCIE_ PCIESSx_CLKCTRL[1:0] MODULEMODE registers. When PCIe_SS is disabled, the PRCM module automatically disables the APLL_PCIE. Please note that setting [1:0] MODE_SELECT bitfield to 0x0 does not disable the APLL_PCIE. .

bitenum.description: Module is disabled by SW. Any OCP access to module results in an error, except if resulting from a module wakeup (asynchronous wakeup).

Module is explicitly enabled. Interface clock (if not used for functions) may be gated according to the clock domain state. Functional clocks are guaranteed to stay present. As long as in this configuration, power domain sleep transition cannot happen.

register.description: This register enables the domain power state transition. It controls the HW supervised domain power state transition between ON-ACTIVE and ON-INACTIVE states. It also hold one status bit per clock input of the domain.

bitfield.description: WARNING: This bit field must not be programmed for SW_SLEEP or HW_AUTO for EEE mode. Controls the clock state transition of the GMAC clock domain.

bitenum.description: NO_SLEEP: Sleep transition cannot be initiated. Wakeup transition may however occur.
SW_SLEEP: Start a software forced sleep transition on the domain.
SW_WKUP: Start a software forced wake-up transition on the domain.
HW_AUTO: Automatic transition is enabled. Sleep and wakeup transition are based upon hardware conditions.

bitenum.description: Module is disabled by SW. Any OCP access to module results in an error, except if resulting from a module wakeup (asynchronous wakeup).

register.description: This register manages the OCP2SCP1 clocks and the optional clock of USB PHY.

bitfield.description: Module idle status. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Module is fully functional, including OCP
Module is performing transition: wakeup, or sleep, or sleep abortion
Module is in Idle mode (only OCP part). It is functional if using separate functional clock
Module is disabled and cannot be accessed

bitfield.description: Control the way mandatory clocks are managed.

bitenum.description: Module is disabled by SW. Any OCP access to module results in an error, except if resulting from a module wakeup (asynchronous wakeup).

Module is managed automatically by HW according to clock domain transition. A clock domain sleep transition put module into idle. A wakeup domain transition put it back into function. If CLKTRCTRL=3, any OCP access to module is always granted. Module clocks may be gated according to the clock domain state.

Module is managed automatically by HW according to clock domain transition. A clock domain sleep transition put module into idle. A wakeup domain transition put it back into function. If CLKTRCTRL=3, any OCP access to module is always granted. Module clocks may be gated according to the clock domain state.

Module is managed automatically by HW according to clock domain transition. A clock domain sleep transition put module into idle. A wakeup domain transition put it back into function.
